item.title: CHAR development
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:8, topic:333890”][quote author=cows1471 link=topic=430290.msg3161012#msg3161012 date=1269547558]
But what about importing 459 npcs into a 317 debo client?
[/quote]
would be fairly simple why?
if i was doing it this is what i would do.

Edit the 459 client to dump the object data, and compare the values of the early objects with a 317 / 377 object dump, i would then, modify the dump abit so it dumped in 100 percent 317 format so i could just copy and paste large quantities of custom objects into the client, i would then use a tool on rune serba to ompress all objects in class46 and the cache into a loc.dat and loc.idx. I would pack those into the cache and then repeat.[/quote]
You would but why never did?

Read full topic

item.title: CHAR development
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

cows1471:

Pmd u dude

There’s a way to import the 562 graphics, models and everything into a 317.

Basically, the client must be re-worked a bit. By a bit, I mean a lot…You need to make new methods to import new IDX files and the .DAT0 and files like it…

It’s best to just leave a 317 as a 317, if you want to import NPC models, just simply dump the NPC.IDX and NPC.DAT file from the cache of a 377, 459, 474, 508, or whatever.

After you do that, replace the one in the old client…Theres a problem though, as runescape developed, they changed emote ID’s, so unless you plan to load emotes through .XML documents, your fucked with over 20 hours of mindless coding.

Read full topic

would be fairly simple why?
if i was doing it this is what i would do.

Edit the 459 client to dump the object data, and compare the values of the early objects with a 317 / 377 object dump, i would then, modify the dump abit so it dumped in 100 percent 317 format so i could just copy and paste large quantities of custom objects into the client, i would then use a tool on rune serba to ompress all objects in class46 and the cache into a loc.dat and loc.idx. I would pack those into the cache and then repeat.

on my 317 source i converted, i pretty much had to remove so much that the source became like 100 kb, and i really cba finish it.

O.T. you are better off converting rs2hd down from 508 to 459 and then refactoring it, because personally i know the reason you want to convert a 317 source to 459 is because of the file structure and simplicity which i understand.[/quote]

item.title: CHAR development
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

cows1471:

Can you help me converting a 317 to 459?

don’t do it, you pretty much have to clean everything out of the server to convert it, and then be able to loggin, everything basically related to packets and loggin and frame / configs.

on my 317 source i converted, i pretty much had to remove so much that the source became like 100 kb, and i really cba finish it.

O.T. you are better off converting rs2hd down from 508 to 459 and then refactoring it, because personally i know the reason you want to convert a 317 source to 459 is because of the file structure and simplicity which i understand.

Read full topic

item.title: CHAR development
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

Sure why not Moderator can lock if he / she wants

One major problem with a player is if a char fucks up. The character design i mean. It’s not unknown and can make the server lag, throw a nullpoint e.t.c.

So we need a way to fix charachter design.

public void validCharDesign() { //Developed to make sure player chars will come out ok. if (pHead < 0 ||pHead > 9) pHead=1; if (pBeard < 10 ||pBeard > 17) pBeard=10; if (pTorso < 18 ||pTorso > 25) pTorso=18; if (pArms < 26 ||pArms > 32) pArms=26; if (pHands < 33 ||pHands > 35) pHands=33; if (pLegs < 36 ||pLegs > 41) pLegs=36; if (pFeet < 42 ||pFeet > 44) pFeet=42; } else if (pGender == 1) { if (pHead < 45 || pHead > 55) pHead=50; if (pBeard > 0) pBeard=1; if (pTorso < 61 || pTorso > 66) pTorso=57; if (pArms < 67 || pArms > 69) pArms=62; if (pHands < 70 || pHands > 78) pHands=68; if (pLegs < 79 || pLegs > 81) pLegs=72; if (pFeet < 82 || pFeet > 84) pFeet=80; }

So what does this do?

Its pretty simple really, it reads the CHAR and says if the player charachter part e.g. players feet is less than 82 in IDs, or more than 84, it will automatically become 80.

So now all you have to do is call

validCharDesign()

To try and stop the chars messing up

This will not stop random char wipes but will make the player…Well i suppose more stable

Simple, yet effective.

~Bill

Read full topic
